Name: Statuette of Mehet-Weret
Description: This statuette represents the goddess in human form with a cow's head. She was called Mehet-Weret, or the "Great Flood," and was the goddess of the sky. She stands with her left leg forward. Her right arm is by her side firmly closed while her left arm is in front of her to hold a scepter that does not exist any more. The goddess wears a long wig reaching her chest and a long transparent dress made of linen intended to give the impression that she is naked. On her head is the horned sun disk crown. The statuette is an example of fine sculpture that shows the very graceful feminine body of a goddess.
